alert.note: Alert for Greater Portland Metro Area (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 18 at 8:39PM PST until December 19 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SUNDAY FOR ELEVATIONS ABOVE 700 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches for elevations above 700 feet. * WHERE...In Washington, Greater Vancouver Area. In Oregon, Greater Portland Metro Area. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels may be lower across western Washington County across far northwest Multnomah County and parts of central and northern Clark County. A dusting to 1 inch of snow is possible as low as the valley floor from Forest Grove to Hillsboro to Banks, as well as from Scappoose eastward across northern Vancouver to Battle Ground. Very little if any snow accumulation is expected for other areas, including: Downtown Portland, Downtown Vancouver, the Portland Airport, Oregon City, and Troutdale. Snow amounts between 1 and 3 inches expected for the West Hills in Portland and the Chehalem Mountains.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions visit https://www.tripcheck.com or https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map or by calling 5 1 1
